incident_detail_panel module

class incident_detail_panel.IncidentDetailPanel(fonts)[source]

Bases: object

Detail view for a single incident. Intended to replace the incidents list panel when the user clicks on an incident card.

Style and sizing follow the same conventions as IncidentsPanel.

Exposes click handling for three controls:

  • Close (top-right ‘X’)

  • Respond (primary action button)

  • Clear (secondary action button)

draw_incident_detail(incident, screen)[source]

Render the incident detail panel.

The User is notified in the main screen of the GUI of the detected incident details if any.

id, title, time, severity, Platform, drone_coords, global_coords - param screen: pygame Surface (main screen)

handle_click(pos)[source]

Translate a mouse position (screen coords) into a semantic action. Returns one of: ‘close’, ‘respond’, ‘clear’, or None if no control was hit.

Args:

  • pos (tuple): (x, y) mouse position in screen coordinates.

Returns:

  • str or None: Action string if a control was clicked, else None. str output depends on which control was clicked.

incident_detail_panel.incidents_severity_index(incident)[source]

Helper to convert incident[‘severity’] to index for severity_colors, clamping to valid range (0-based).

Args:

  • incident (dict): Incident data dictionary.

Returns:

  • int: Severity index (0-based).
